Lead Developer - Laravel - WORK REMOTE! - Jobmote

Lead Developer - Laravel - WORK REMOTE!

Kirschbaum Development Group

Job Description

We are seeking a Lead Developer to work on a variety of projects ranging from SaaS products and e-commerce sites, to building out API's and architecting backend tools. Candidate works remotely.

In addition to the details outlined below, a successful candidate will have expert level understanding and experience with Object Oriented Programming, will be self motivated, have a love for learning and new technology, and able to lead and mentor others.

The ideal candidate will be a full-stack web application developer (talented on both frontend and backend) who has a knack for problem solving and critical thinking. We are looking for someone with experience architecting solutions and breaking business requirements down into achievable technical tasks. Experience with pair programming, code review, and developing team best practices is also important.

Must be able to work Eastern Standard Time hours between 9 a.m. to 4 p.m.

Great benefits including:

  • Competitive Salary
  • Paid Vacation
  • Health Insurance
  • Company Computer
  • Personal Budget for Books/Conferences
  • Year-end Bonus

Responsibilities

  • Show excellent judgement in architecting and planning applications and features at all stages of the project lifecycle.
  • Interact effectively with clients to determine project needs and develop solutions
  • Attention to detail and the ability to consistently deliver quality work
  • Takes overall accountability for keeping the project clean and organized. This includes identifying next steps, clarifying unclear tickets, and breaking larger tickets into smaller and more manageable tasks.
  • Takes professional accountability for getting things done. Does whatever it takes to make things happen, or gives advance warning if things aren't going well so we can arrange for help.
  • Understands successful concepts in UI, UX, design cleanliness, and design balance, and takes appropriate action to resolve situations where minimum standards are not being met.
  • Takes overall accountability for the quality of code we write on a project.
  • Takes overall accountability for the stability of a project.
  • Ensures all team members on the project are clear on their tasks and have sufficient work for the day/week.
  • Keeps the team laser focused on our objectives and helps to resolve any issues that may arise.
  • Runs project meetings when a delivery manager / scrum master is not on meetings.
  • Reviews code carefully and provides constructive feedback.
  • Responsible for keeping a production deployment path clear, and ensures that they are not a bottleneck for deployments.
  • Full Stack - architectural design and development of web applications
  • Use Laravel, Vue.js, and Angular.js to work on a variety of projects such as SaaS products and E-Commerce sites

Qualifications

  • Experience in a lead developer role, including:
    • 5+ years experience with PHP
    • 4+ years experience with Javascript (experience with a javascript framework such as Angular or Vue.js preferable)
    • 3+ years experience with Laravel
    • 3+ years experience with application design/architecture
    • Advanced understanding of HTML, CSS, and JQuery
  • Familiar with Agile development methodologies
  • Advanced experience/knowledge of database architecture and design
  • History/knowledge of successful development workflows
  • History/knowledge of successful team workflows
  • Strong critical thinking skills
  • Good communication and writing skills
  • An eye for detail and a commitment to quality work
  • Bachelor's degree preferred
  • Previous customer service and client communication experience preferred
  • Must be able to work Eastern Standard Time hours of 9 a.m. to 4 p.m.

Company DescriptionKirschbaum Development Group is a boutique software engineering firm focused on solving interesting and complex business problems for our clients.

We typically work with a small number of clients using a collaborative approach and leading edge technologies. Our customers range from small startups to some of the largest companies in the world in developing products, streamlining processes and creating better channels of communication to their customers. Additionally, we build our own SaaS products and are always working on new tools and products to improve solution delivery.

We are proud to be partnered with Laravel. Click the link to learn more about our partnership:

items.content:
Citrix NetScaler - Lead Architect - Large Environment (Remote Work) - Jobmote

Citrix NetScaler - Lead Architect - Large Environment (Remote Work)

Virtual Dynamics Corporation

Job Description

We are seeking a Citrix NetScaler Lead Architect for a large 45,000 user assignment. Must have 5+ years experience and be CCA-N Certified.

Although the primary responsibilities will revolve around the design, planning and deployment of Citrix NetScalers, the proper candidate will also possess solid knowledge around the Citrix XenApp and XenDesktop products as it will be necessary for integration.

This position is remote, with occasional on-site meetings.

Responsibilities:

  • Assess customer requirements globally and translate business requirements into technical requirements.
  • Expert with High Availability, Traffic Management, Load Balancing, GSLB and SSL Certificates
  • Expert with Virtual Servers, Preauthentication Policies, LDAP and Radius
  • Some work with Portal Themes to customize for use
  • Able to backup and restore NetScalers
  • Enforce policies for standardizing systems

Qualifications:

  • 5 years working on Citrix NetScalers
  • Expert level knowledge of the Citrix NetScaler, specifically as it applies to GSLB and Access to XenApp, XenDesktop
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Strong troubleshooting and critical thinking skills
  • Strong attention to detail

Company DescriptionVirtual Dynamics offers end-to-end consulting services for server, desktop and application virtualization and cloud infrastructures. Our service offerings are based on in-depth virtualization expertise, proven best practices and repeatable delivery methodologies to help customers realize the full value of virtualization for IT as a service computing models faster, and with less risk. Based on best practices from working on hundreds of projects and using reliable, repeatable methodologies, our services are designed to help you assess your current environments, plan and design solutions that meet your desired business objectives, build and implement your desired virtualization solutions and manage your environment with staff augmentation and performance tuning.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=4, go=0, nodejs=4, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=2, java=1, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=44}
items.content:
As a remote mobile engineer working on Mogul Arena you will serve as the engineering owner for the mobile initiative, and be responsible for translating and integrating new design mockup resources into native or Javascript using the React Native framework and interacting with existing web-based RESTful API’s. You are expected to keep conformity to best practices for mobile applications and ensuring the best possible experience for gamers.

Job Responsibilities

  • Develop, and support high-quality mobile applications powering Mogul Arena.

  • Take engineering/code ownership of the mobile application initiative.

  • Write, analyze, optimize, and debug code to maximize performance and quality.

  • Work closely with cross-functional departments to quickly prototype, design and implement ideas and projects.

  • Generate documentation and technical/functional specifications as needed.

  • Participate in agile planning and scope estimation for team projects.

Pre-Requisites

  • Engineering talent demonstrated by excellent work experience, hobby projects, open-source contributions, or superior academic results.

  • 3+ years of experience in mobile development, specifically Javascript and React Native.

  • Good understanding of mobile interface design patterns and composition.

  • Experience working in an agile or lean software development environment.

  • You are familiar with the following technology:

    • Javascript (ES6)

    • React Native

    • Expo SDK

    • Vue.js is a plus

    • Android and iOS Native is a plus

    • Git

    • WebSockets

  • Deep hands-on technical expertise and problem-solving skills

  • Strong English-language communication (verbal and written) and documentation skills

  • Ability to work in a collaborative, technically challenging environment with rapidly changing requirements

  • A scrappy, entrepreneurial attitude that gets high-quality projects done quickly

  • A Keen eye for design and understands the requirements for translating design documents and resources into a working web-based product.

  • Strong communication skills to maintain the channels between engineering and design, and to translate the concepts/ideas across efficiently and accurately.

Special Considerations

  • You are a passionate game developer and/or game player (PC, console, or mobile) who understands gamer culture.

  • You have an active GitHub profile with open-source contributions.

  • Willingness to switch between mobile and web-based development as needed.

items.content:
WWW.WATCHR.CO.UK ● LONDON, UNITED KINGDOM ● ENGINEERING

Watchr.co.uk is the fastest growing marketplace to buy and sell watches and jewellery 100% online. Gone are the days of haggling for the best price with the salesman. Instead, Watchr makes the process simple, trustworthy and even fun! We combine a rigorous certification process, an industry-leading pricing algorithm, and the world's best buying process to delight all our customers. Thanks to our great team, we’re changing the watch industry from the ground up.

Watchr is currently backed by top tier angel investors and family offices and raised a Seed round in December.

That's us, let's talk about you.

Watchr is currently looking for a driven, entrepreneurial, and hands on Front End Developer. As Front End Developer you will jump into the business by taking full ownership of building and scaling all product lines. You will build products from existing ideas, as well as developing new ideas based on your industry experience.

This position is exciting, requires excellence, and an entrepreneurial mindset. It provides responsibility and freedom to build and grow an innovative product. This will require you to act as both a strategic leader and a materialiser, with a unique blend of business and technical savvy; a big-picture vision, and the drive to make that vision a reality.

This position is meant for those of you who challenge the status quo on a daily basis, seek and desire to radically change the inefficiencies in the world, and get what it means to build movements and not just machines.

The right candidate will join our tech team from remote and will be mainly focused on supporting our Lead Developer polishing the new website, fixing bugs, CSS to HTML edits and so on.

Requirements

JavaScript ES5/6
Typescript
Knowledge of Angular 4/5/6
Knowledge of CSS3 (Flexbox, CSS Grid, BEM Methodology)
SVG, PNG and image optimisation
Excellent communication skills
Attention to detail
Fluent English Speaker


Benefits

What We Are Offering

A fast-paced start-up experience in a high growth company. What more could you want?
Work with a high-performance team who will fight beside you in the trenches to accomplish the amazing
Huge learning opportunity: you will be working closely to seasoned entrepreneurs
Everyone matters, no matter what your role is!

items.title: Waggl, Inc: Experienced Ruby on Rails Developer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=5, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=60, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=50}
items.content:
Experienced Ruby on Rails Developer

Posted Jun 21

Waggl, Inc
Headquarters: Sausalito, CA
www.waggl.com
View all Waggl, Inc jobs →

Waggl is looking for experienced Ruby on Rails Web Developers to join our growing team.

How we are different

We know that as a developer you can work many places.  Waggl’s work environment is unique.

  • We care deeply about our work.  Both the quality of what we produce and its impact.
  • We believe everyone deserves to have their voice heard from a brand new hire to the CEO.  This is key to our product and our culture. We check titles at the door.
  • We trust you.  You can work from home, in the office, or from an RV traveling across the country as long as you stay connected and get your work done.  We trust you to take the time off you feel you need to recharge and be your best. No questions asked.
  • We improve the work lives of hundreds of thousands of people around the world.
  • We are growing like crazy.
  • All these things and more have led us to be named as one of the Best Places to Work in the US by Inc magazine.

How we work

We work really hard to balance collaboration, autonomy, efficiency and high quality output.  We do this through informal interactions, short daily meetings, and efficient planning meetings.  Our primary technology stack is Ruby On Rails, React, and Backbone. We also use Less and Coffeescript (transitioning to ES6) to make frontend work more enjoyable.  Our team is made up of developers, designers and QA folks.

Where you fit in

Our system is robust enough to have interesting technical challenges but not so big that you only get to work on one specialized portion of the system.  We are looking for people to contribute in the following ways:

  • Develop new features (front-end, back-end, or both).
  • Help us further scale our platform (both through optimization and re-architecting as needed)
  • Contribute to the team's best practices and effectiveness.
  • Help teammates and give feedback on their code
  • Investigate production systems errors
  • Work on other special technical projects

Requirements

  • 3+ years Ruby on Rails and Javascript
  • Normal work hours are EDT, CDT, or PDT, AST (e.g. you live in North America, Central America, or South America)
  • Fluent spoken and written english
  • Team player

Nice to have

  • Experience with a javascript framework (React, Backbone, Angular, etc)
  • Experience writing tests
  • Experience optimizing sql queries.
  • CoffeeScript

About Waggl

Waggl (www.waggl.com) is the most human way for organizations to crowdsource feedback. Waggl lives at the intersection of two organizational realities: companies want to be on the pulse of their employees and employees want to know that their opinions count. Featured in WSJ, Entrepreneur, and Fast Company, Waggl is one of the leading platforms to help organizations become more agile, aligned and hyper-aware, so they can make better decisions and execute more effectively.

Waggl provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Waggl complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Apply for this position

Please apply at https://goo.gl/forms/NxMVN80Ced4DPLGA2

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=1, go=0, nodejs=9, bigdata-ml=6, ruby=0, apple=0, java=2, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=44}
items.content:
Senior Software Engineer - JavaScript

Posted Jun 21

Monetate
Headquarters: Conshohocken, PA
https://www.monetate.com/about/careers
View all Monetate jobs →

WHO WE ARE: 
Monetate is built on the principle that all people are different and that a customer-centric perspective will outperform a “one-size-fits-all” approach. Our SaaS platform uses machine learning and artificial intelligence to enable world-class brands to deliver relevant, personalized experiences to all of their customers across all of their channels (web, mobile, in-store, etc.), in real-time, and at scale - we served more than two billion personalized experiences over Cyber weekend alone.

Our Services team is a passionate group of Client Success Managers, Platform Consultants, Web Developers, Engineers, Analysts, and Tech Support. We work closely together to deliver strategic solutions that are driven by a highly usable, marketer-friendly interface. We encounter a lot of difficult and fun challenges involving machine learning, statistics, data visualization, real-time decisioning, user interface, and plenty more.

Monetate has offices located in NYC, Conshohocken, PA (just outside of Philly), and London and we focus on hiring the absolute best talent by welcoming remote employees as well. If you want to be a part of a bigger purpose, bringing cutting edge technology to market, Monetate is  the spot for you!

WHAT YOU’LL DO AS A JAVASCRIPT ENGINEER:
You will work primarily with Javascript, HTML and CSS to build components used in a variety of web experiences.  Running in real time on high-traffic e-commerce sites, these components will help marketers deliver the best customer experience to their users. You will 
  • Use HTML and CSS to dynamically change site content
  • Write elegant and robust solutions to complex problems
  • Use modular vanilla Javascript in a dynamic environment with various external codebases
  • Analyze the markup and code of our clients’ websites to determine the best ways to present content
  • Put user experience first when it comes to contributing to any user facing product
  • Work with account managers to determine business requirements and assess feasibility of solutions
  • Collaborate with our solutions engineering team to customize and integrate our platform with third party backend systems
  • Not afraid to challenge the status quo when necessary, and at the same time respect the opinions presented by your team

WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR:
We're looking for an agile self-starter with a deep understanding of various scripting languages. If you're a problem-solver who is passionate about rich web applications, scaling internet applications to billions of pageviews, and working with big data, then you're a perfect fit for our team!
  • 5+ years of web development experience 
  • In-depth understanding of HTML and CSS
  • Experience using Javascript to manipulate web pages using one or more major JS library
  • Experience building standards-compliant, cross-browser HTML content 
  • Working knowledge of web-optimized image delivery formats
  • Detail and quality oriented
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Excellent communication skills
  • A value for regularly delivering solutions that have direct customer impact
  • Demonstrated ability to be adaptable and successful in a fast-paced environment

BONUS POINTS FOR:
  • Knowledge of Responsive Design
  • Mobile web development experience a plus
  • Experience determining business requirements and needs
  • Comfortable communicating with clients, including high-level contacts
  • Some experience with other languages such as python or java

OUR TEAM & CULTURE: 
We’re relentlessly customer focused: Everything we do, we do to make things better for our customers. We innovate and continuously improve. Better products. Better service. More Value. Repeat.
We’re here to win: We lead in a market that never stops moving. We have the courage to commit, to make tough decisions and when we need to we turn on a dime.
We love this stuff: We hire smart, fun, talented people who want to make a difference. We’re  building the world’s most amazing team of personalisation zealots.
We’ve got each others backs: We value candor, appreciate diversity and insist on respect. We’re here for each other. Every day. We win as a team with a shared spirit of optimism. 
We’re owners and we act  like it: We take initiative, act with urgency and are accountable for results. We’re all engaged.
Integrity is non-negotiable: Our customers, suppliers, partners, stakeholders, communities and competitors can all trust us to do the right thing. No exceptions.

PERKS:
As a team of personalization zealots our benefits are designed and tailored to meet our individual specifications, needs and preferences:
  • We pride ourselves on upholding a respectful and supportive environment; if there's something you need to get your work done, we’ll get it for you
  • We understand that everyone is different. We have flexible hours, no dress code, and you're free to migrate between dedicated desks (standing or traditional), private rooms, open lounges with couches, or your home office
  • Lunch is catered daily (and it’s free!)
  • Unlimited PTO  
  • 12 weeks of fully paid maternity leave and 4 weeks of fully paid paternity leave
  • Multiple Benefit Options: Medical, Dental, Vision, FSA, Transportation Reimbursement
  • Option for equity in a late stage startup backed by top tier VC’s 
  • 401k 


Monetate is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate against age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief sex and sexual orientation.

Apply for this position

https://hire.withgoogle.com/public/jobs/monetate/view/P_AAAAAACAAADEODJ0FwIMTo

items.content:
Company Description

Join the payever team!

70+ employees. Talented people worldwide.
4 countries. An international reach.
1 mission. Becoming the ultimate open commerce platform for business and private customers.

payever started with a simple idea: We want to make buying and selling easier everyday. With a team of over 70 members around the world, we've built a unique CommerceOS with all the tools people need to start, run and grow their business. After 4 years of high growth and international expansion, we’re currently working on even more new apps to enhance the entire commerce experience, and it’s your chance to take part in innovation.

Join our team of digital natives with deep retail and tech expertise, supported by Europe's leading early stage investors High Tech-Gründerfonds and Microsoft Ventures.

Job Description

We are currently looking for an experienced and detail-oriented individual to join our remote team as Frontend Developer. You should be able to translate our company and customer needs into functional and appealing interactive applications.

If you’re interested in creating a user-friendly environment by writing code and moving forward in your career, then this job is for you.

In this role, your day will look something like this:

- Create complex applications;
- Write and review code cooperating with a large team of international professionals
- Develop UI components base on our own ui-kit system, delivering the best UX to customers
- Create solutions using our own bootstrapping system to code with

Qualifications

You'll fit right in if you have the following skills:

Your profile:

- MS/BS in Computer Science, Engineering or similar relevant field;
- 4+ years’ experience in with HTML/CSS;
- Strong knowledge of native JavaScript (ES2015+);
- Experience with Angular.js, React.js or any other MVVM framework/library;
- Knowledge with TypeScript & RxJS is preferred;
- Understanding of Node.js and WebPack, NPM;
- Experience with code testing: Jasmine, Karma;
- Flexibility and readiness to follow style-guide;
- Familiarity with Git;
- Bootstrap.

Who you are:

- You’re fluent in English, and a good communicator
- You have an entrepreneurial spirit
- You possess a collaborative, open-minded and helpful approach to teamwork
- You’re motivated and a self-starter
- You’re able to organise and work with multiple projects and different deadlines

Additional information

We’re now 4 years old, but we’re hungry like it’s Day One - we still have the same big dreams and are looking for your help to achieve them!

What we offer:

Our Team

Our people are our best feature. We help each other out, laugh, help, support, and discuss everyone’s point of view, in an agile way.

Flat structure and full transparency

Flat hierarchies and short decision paths mean that more of your ideas are heard, and turned into realities. Less bureaucracy, more results!

Focus on your growth

Clear career path from the start, access to learning material and a plan for your professional growth, so you’ll always know what to expect.

Competitive pay rates

We want our talent to be able to fully concentrate on their work. Which is why make sure you are paid well and on time.

Sound exciting? We think so too, and we can’t wait to hear from you!

items.content:
Job description
We are looking for a passionate CGO/Lead Game Developer to design and develop our game platform. If you love to stay on top of cutting-edge technologies and want to create a revolutionary product with us. If you seek an opportunity to make a direct impact in the industry, shine within the company and with outside stakeholders. There is no limit to your role, except your own ambition.
You will be a valued member of the core team and take part in all high-level decision making. You will be responsible for the games tech side and in charge of making it happen. You will follow your passion, be present in the struggle and own a part of the success.
We value attitude, mentality and cultural fit over experience; however previous experience in a startup is a big plus.
Some people need to be told exactly what to do, and when. If you are not one of these people and you have the entrepreneurial and startup mindset, you are a risk taker who wants to shape the growth of a disruptive business in gaming, then we have got the perfect opportunity for you!
Our offices are located in London and Athens. Mainly you will work remotely, however face to face meetings are required following business needs.
We also strive for that great balance of being a team that feels like a family. That means we share feedback regularly, support each other's self-improvement efforts and personal plans, and see honest mistakes as opportunities to learn together.

Skills
HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, SQL Server, MySQL, C++, C#, Java , ASP-MVC, Razor, PHP, JQuery, Unity, Unreal
Benefits
Flexible working hours. Work the hours that make you more happy and productive, keeping in mind time-zones and work deliverables. Simultaneously learn and contribute, while working with big studios and indie developers. You will get the opportunity to work with the best, take on a lot of responsibility and grow.
Compensation
Stock Options program. Joining the Conclify core team, means you are entrusted to own part of the company.

Job Responsibilities

Develop a kickass game platform
Develop long and short term strategies and tactics for growth
Make tough decisions while being aware of the impact on the business
Lead the game(s) production process
Develop and manage Conclify's game developers' network
Maintain and extend existing server applications (ASP, PHP)
Maintain and extend existing web-pages (HTML5/CSS3, JavaScript)
Maintain and extend existing database servers (SQL Server, MySQL)


Required Skills

Have the entrepreneurial and startup mindset
Can do attitude with speed and product in mind
Excellent communication skills
Business mindset. Decision making. Problem solving.
Leadership and Team building skills.
Good working knowledge of back-end technologies and languages (C#, ASP-MVC, Razor, PHP)
Good working knowledge of web-page technologies and languages (HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, JQuery)
Good working knowledge of database technologies and languages (SQL Server, MySQL, SQL)
Good working knowledge of various game engines (Unity, Unreal)
Understanding of a range of languages commonly used in game development (C++, C#, JavaScript, Java)
Understanding of a range of front-end frameworks (Bootstrap, Materialize)
Understanding of a range of communication protocols and methodologies (HTTP, SSL, AJAX)
Understanding of a range of hosting services (Azure, AWS)
Track record in the gaming industry.
Ability to develop a simple Game. Creative in new game concepts.

items.content:
About this job

Job type: Contract
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Full Stack Developer, Mobile Developer
Industry: Enterprise Web Solutions, Mobile Application, Software Development
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Technologies

ecmascript-6javascriptreactjsreact-nativenode.js

Job description

We are looking for a remote Javascript Engineer to assist with our React Native projects. We specialise in building bespoke software for global businesses. We are remote-first by design and have a team of highly-skilled and multi-disciplined engineers. We are proponents of Agile methodologies and our primary focus is to deliver exceptional value to our customers.

Currently, we are building applications across retail, energy, and IoT sectors. Our applications make life simpler; whether its processing millions of transactions or automating the smart home.

We are looking for a talented Engineer with a very strong Javascript background to join our React Native team. You should be used to working with React Native and Redux. Naturally, any native mobile experience would give you a competitive edge in this role too.

This role is a full time position and you can work from wherever you want. Our remote-first team are spread across 14 different countries. Our HQ is based in London, UK and you are welcome to drop by to say hello!

Please Note: This isn't a front end web developer role, it's for app development using React Native.

Skills & Qualifications

  • MUST: Very strong Javascript background (React Native, Node, Redux, ES6)
  • MUST: Experience performing in a team and working harmoniously with others
  • MUST: Native level written and spoken English
  • MUST: Have at least some native iOS or Android mobile application development experience
  • SHOULD HAVE: Experience working with different languages and technologies
  • SHOULD HAVE: Functional programming experience
  • SHOULD HAVE: Ability to navigate, understand, and reuse large existing codebases
  • SHOULD HAVE: A basic understanding of UI/UX design principles
  • SHOULD HAVE: Experience working with complex server-side design

Responsibilities

This role is perfect for a candidate that not only enjoys development, but also wants to have input on the best approach and implementation method. On a typical day you will:

  • Work in dynamic squads in a team of 15+ skilled & enthusiastic React engineers
  • Morning stand-up with the team via video, a full structured development process
  • Have a direct input in application architecture decisions
  • Write efficient and testable code
  • Review PRs created by your fellow team members
  • Document your code concisely and clearly
  • Take part in regular retrospectives to improve the team process

Extra Perks

  • Join our Open Source Accelerator and get funding and support towards open source projects!
  • Work on applications used by millions of active users.
  • Opportunity to contribute to our new in-house machine learning project.

Benefits

  • $7-9.5k per month (experience based)
  • Work remotely
  • Great compensation
  • Flexible holiday
  • Rewarding work on bleeding-edge technology
  • Career development - investment in your skills
  • Exceptional support network from your team members
Apply now

About Purepoint

What we look for

An ideal candidate is autonomous, proactive, and has experience working in a variety of different languages. We admire developers who take initiative, make their own decisions and implement them clearly.

Delivering exceptional value to our clients is imperative. The ideal candidate is the perfect brand ambassador; a brilliant technical mind with the accompanying interpersonal skills necessary to function in a team environment.

As a Purepoint developer you will work in a small and close-knit group. Our mindset is focused on constant iteration and improvement.

Tools

We will give you all of the tools necessary to excel at your role. We use Jira, Trello, Slack, Github and Zoom (video conferencing) in our day-to-day business.

Our managerial structure is very flat. We put customer experience and satisfaction first and really believe in delivering a service that is cutting edge.

Benefits

  • Remote
  • Unlimited Holiday Days
  • Competitive Pay
  • Personal Development
  • Open Source Funding
  • Free Lunch Fridays
  • Central London HQ

items.content:
About this job

Job type: Contract
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Full Stack Developer, Mobile Developer
Industry: Enterprise Web Solutions, Mobile Application, Software Development
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Technologies

ecmascript-6javascriptreactjsreact-nativenode.js

Job description

We are looking for a remote Javascript Engineer to assist with our React Native projects. We specialise in building bespoke software for global businesses. We are remote-first by design and have a team of highly-skilled and multi-disciplined engineers. We are proponents of Agile methodologies and our primary focus is to deliver exceptional value to our customers.

Currently, we are building applications across retail, energy, and IoT sectors. Our applications make life simpler; whether its processing millions of transactions or automating the smart home.

We are looking for a talented Engineer with a very strong Javascript background to join our React Native team. You should be used to working with React Native and Redux. Naturally, any native mobile experience would give you a competitive edge in this role too.

This role is a full time position and you can work from wherever you want. Our remote-first team are spread across 14 different countries. Our HQ is based in London, UK and you are welcome to drop by to say hello!

Please Note: This isn't a front end web developer role, it's for app development using React Native.

Skills & Qualifications

  • MUST: Very strong Javascript background (React Native, Node, Redux, ES6)
  • MUST: Experience performing in a team and working harmoniously with others
  • MUST: Native level written and spoken English
  • MUST: Have at least some native iOS or Android mobile application development experience
  • SHOULD HAVE: Experience working with different languages and technologies
  • SHOULD HAVE: Ability to navigate, understand, and reuse large existing codebases
  • SHOULD HAVE: A basic understanding of UI/UX design principles
  • SHOULD HAVE: Functional programming experience
  • SHOULD HAVE: Experience working with complex server-side design

Responsibilities

This role is perfect for a candidate that not only enjoys development, but also wants to have input on the best approach and implementation method. On a typical day you will:

  • Work in dynamic squads in a team of 15+ skilled & enthusiastic React engineers
  • Morning stand-up with the team via video, a full structured development process
  • Have a direct input in application architecture decisions
  • Write efficient and testable code
  • Review PRs created by your fellow team members
  • Document your code concisely and clearly
  • Take part in regular retrospectives to improve the team process

Extra Perks

  • Join our Open Source Accelerator and get funding and support towards open source projects!
  • Work on applications used by millions of active users.
  • Opportunity to contribute to our new in-house machine learning project.

Benefits

  • $7-9.5k per month (experience based)
  • Work remotely
  • Great compensation
  • Flexible holiday
  • Rewarding work on bleeding-edge technology
  • Career development - investment in your skills
  • Exceptional support network from your team members
Apply now

About Purepoint

What we look for

An ideal candidate is autonomous, proactive, and has experience working in a variety of different languages. We admire developers who take initiative, make their own decisions and implement them clearly.

Delivering exceptional value to our clients is imperative. The ideal candidate is the perfect brand ambassador; a brilliant technical mind with the accompanying interpersonal skills necessary to function in a team environment.

As a Purepoint developer you will work in a small and close-knit group. Our mindset is focused on constant iteration and improvement.

Tools

We will give you all of the tools necessary to excel at your role. We use Jira, Trello, Slack, Github and Zoom (video conferencing) in our day-to-day business.

Our managerial structure is very flat. We put customer experience and satisfaction first and really believe in delivering a service that is cutting edge.

Benefits

  • Remote
  • Unlimited Holiday Days
  • Competitive Pay
  • Personal Development
  • Open Source Funding
  • Free Lunch Fridays
  • Central London HQ
  • Open Workspace Available

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Computer Software, Enterprise Software, Software Consulting
Company size: 1k-5k people
Company type: Private

Technologies

ruby-on-railsrubyjavascriptmysqlhtml

Job description

ESW Capital takes an unorthodox approach to hiring in an attempt to improve the candidate experience by expediting the hiring process through an innovate online hiring tournament. Candidates will receive an offer as soon as the day of the event should they be successful.

We're running an Online Hiring Tournament on June 23rd to hire Ruby on Rails Software Architects (USD $60K/yr).

This event will include testing. Upon grading the deliverables from the event, we will set up qualified candidates with an interview with the hiring manager. This is a 100% remote, full-time role.

Candidate Requirements:

  • 5+ years of experience as both a hands-on architect and a software engineer

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or Computer Engineering

  • Leadership experience in creating, deploying, and iterating excellent software

  • Proficiency in the following skills and technologies is mandatory:

    • Knowledge of backend programming languages, like C++, Java, C#, Ruby or others

    • Database(SQL server/Oracle/MySQL/MongoDB/Cassandra)

    • SOA, EDA, and Design patterns.

    • Javascript (ReactJS, AngularJS) , HTML5, CSS3

    • Cloud computing architecting

    • Linux, REST, tools for CI/CD (Jenkins), Git, and shell scripting.

    • DevOps

We recommend that you attend the tournament instead of applying online, as our tournament process will be much faster.

Click Apply Now > Register at the green button - you will receive the webinar link after completing registration.

Apply now

Benefits

  • Work from anywhere
  • Choose your own hours
  • Flat organization
  • Work with talented people all over the world
  • Committed to diversity
  • Competitive compensation

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Computer Software, Enterprise Software, Software Consulting
Company size: 1k-5k people
Company type: Private

Technologies

javajavascriptamazon-web-servicesmysql

Job description

ESW Capital takes an unorthodox approach to hiring in an attempt to improve the candidate experience by expediting the hiring process through an innovate online hiring tournament. Candidates will receive an offer as soon as the day of the event should they be successful.

We're running an Online Hiring Tournament on June 23rd to hire Java Chief Software Architects (USD $100K/yr).

This event will include testing. Upon grading the deliverables from the event, we will set up qualified candidates with an interview with the hiring manager. This is a 100% remote, full-time role.

This position is with ESW Capital or one of its affiliated companies.

As a Chief Architect, you will be responsible for developing solutions to complex architectural problems, designing and delivering real enterprise-class software products to customers and being a hands-on peer leader of top development resources. As the owner for the architecture and technical delivery of a multi-million dollar revenue per year enterprise software product, you will effectively work as the CTO of the engagement with a startup mindset, wearing multiple hats from lead architect and developer on the most complex elements of the product to technical team leader to solution evangelist ensuring that the customers are blown away by the technical differentiation and quality of the product.

Candidate Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Electrical Engineering
  • At least 8 years of experience on hands-on development and related technologies
  • Has worked with back-end technologies based and latest development frameworks
  • Has experience working with two or more of data related technologies and familiarity with others from various Relational databases, NoSQL databases, Caching systems, Full-Text Search engines, Big Data systems.
  • Has good experience with the TDD approach, doing unit testing, mocking, integration/UI testing, behavior driver testing.
  • Has good experience working with, setting up and configuring any continuous integration and delivery systems, any code quality automation technologies.
  • Has experience with one or more cloud or devops services like AWS, Docker, Heroku, Digitalocean, etc.
  • Has experience with one or more front-end technologies including templating, CSS and JS frameworks.

We recommend that you attend the tournament instead of applying online, as our tournament process will be much faster.

Click Apply Now > Register at the green button - you will receive the webinar link after completing registration.

Apply now

Benefits

  • Work from anywhere
  • Choose your own hours
  • Flat organization
  • Work with talented people all over the world
  • Committed to diversity
  • Competitive compensation

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=4, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=6, nodejs=4, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=10, embedded=0, frontend=43}
items.content:
High response rate

This company responds to the majority of applications it receives.

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Role: Frontend Developer
Industry: Cloud-Based Solutions, Continuous Delivery, PaaS
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: VC Funded

Technologies

javascriptreactjsuser-interfacepythonredux

Job description


We're looking for a software engineer with front-end application design experience, focused around the upcoming version of our swanky new user interface written with React, Redux, Webpack and our open source Javascript API client. This is intended to be a "lightweight" application which talks exclusively to our back-end APIs for business logic, but which nonetheless has many moving parts and a lot of significant challenges in user experience design, components creation and information presentation -- the overall Platform.sh ecosystem is complex and we are looking for a developer who is keen to solve hard usability challenges... simply.

Must have:

- Senior-level experience with Javascript front-end development, ideally comfortable building out a major application with React, Redux, Styled-components, Webpack, Nightwatch

- Desire to tackle user experience/interface design challenges from a high-level user story view all the way to implementation

- Solid level of experience with web development patterns and a good grasp of different DevOps workflows and tools.  A strong sense of empathy toward other developers.

Nice to have:

- Familiarity with the other languages in our stack (Go, Python, PHP)

- Experience or interest in the "cloud computing" stuff that makes up our back-end, anything from distributed computing and networking to DevOps and the big box that is "make a bunch of Linux containers play nicely together"

Apply now
Ask a question

About Platform.sh

Platform.sh is a next-generation hosting and development tool for a wide variety of web applications. Our platform-as-a-service model is designed to take an application from the developer's app codebase to a working set of cloud environments with as few traditional "devops" challenges as possible. This involves a lot of really cool software (mostly written in a mix of Python and Go, and with user-facing tools in PHP and Javascript as well) that helps us make magical features at all layers of the traditional hosting stack: distributed and redundant storage, automated container orchestration, highly-available applications and services, fast creation and replication of environments, etc.

The company is entirely distributed with an HQ in Paris that 10-15% of the company works out of, various team meetups or occasional get togethers both there and around the world are common

Travel to various developer-oriented events is available to developers who are interested in various conferences both for marketing and educational purposes

Benefits

  • Work from home, wherever you are
  • Safe and friendly working environment
  • Stock options for everyone
  • Rest and recovery are essential to health and happiness; we get that

items.title: Mid-level Front-end Developer at The Hero Company
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=46, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=8, embedded=0, frontend=72}
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Frontend Developer
Industry: Digital Marketing, Digital Media
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Technologies

javascriptnode.jshtml5cssmysql

Job description

The Hero Company is looking for a Mid-level Front-end Developer, and if you’re the right fit for our culture, this may well be the best job you’ve ever had.

We’re looking for an individual who has 4+ years of professional experience using vanilla Javascript and NodeJS. Has a strong work ethic, ability to take ownership and deliver with precision. Possess strong communication skills and the ability to be a team player within a remote team.

* Your Responsibilities:

  • Technical problem solving.
  • Plan, Develop, and Unit test.
  • Work with marketing & copy teams to develop and deliver by established deadlines.
  • Effectively communicating across departments.
  • Adhering to best practices & production standards when developing.
  • Modifying and implementing existing markup, styles, and JavaScript.
  • Produce documentation and specifications.

** Skills & Requirements:

  • GIT (GITHub or GITLab)
  • HTML5
  • Javascript 5/6
    • NodeJS
      • MVC
      • Express
      • PUG
      • Socket.IO
    • jQuery
    • Jasmine (Not Required)
  • CSS
    • SASS
    • BEM (Block Element Modifier)
  • MySQL
  • Gulp (Not Required)
  • ReactJS (Not Required)

Services (Not Required)

  • AWS (S3, Route53, Cloudfront, and EC2)
  • Google Optimize (Not Required)
  • Voluum, Funnel Flux (Not Required)
  • Cake (Not Required)
  • LimeLightCRM (Not Required)

*** The Ideal Candidate Is Also:

  • Relentlessly self-motivated, and extremely driven to succeed. You’ll take direction, but don’t need motivation, to be accountable for your results.

  • Detail-Oriented: you pay attention to how words are spelled, you notice when numbers “don’t add up,” and you’re the first to catch mistakes.

  • Organized and “On Top of It”: you know your area of competence so well that you don’t need to go looking for the answers when someone asks you a question

  • Obsessively Growth Oriented: you look for ways to improve yourself, and the work you do

Salary, Benefits, and Perks:

  • Competitive base pay, based on skills and experience, and the opportunity to grow it quickly.

  • Full Health and Dental Benefits

  • Work from wherever, as long as you perform and are on time for our online meetings and conference calls

  • Unlimited Vacation + Major Holidays Off

----

To Apply:

Please send the following:

  • your resume/CV

  • a 6-8 paragraph introduction. Please send this in the body of the email, and not as a separate attachment.

In this introduction, please tell us about your current experience related to this position, and why you would be a good fit for our company culture.

We can’t wait for the right candidate to join us, and we’re looking forward to hearing from you!

Apply now
Ask a question

About The Hero Company

At our core, The Hero Company is a direct marketing company. In other words…

  • we create incredible products: everything from relationship advice ebooks for single men, to fitness courses for young women, to nutritional guidance for everyone.

  • we create captivating sales and marketing websites to sell those products

  • we buy ads, to drive traffic to our sales and marketing websites

  • we run email promotions to our prospects and customers, to keep them engaged, happy, and buying more

  • we manage the infrastructure required to support it all: the tech, operations, finance and customer support

We’ve been around since 2007, and our team has been responsible for over $50,000,000 of online sales in the past decade. We’ve maintained an A+ Better Business Bureau rating, and just as importantly, rave reviews from our customers.

Even better… we did it all remotely. Despite our distance, we have a fantastic, fun, highly-driven “online culture”, with clear alignment on our values and our mission. We play to win, we learn from our mistakes and we celebrate our victories and each other.

The Hero Company is a poor fit for anyone who wants to “phone it in” or spend their days on social media. Underperformers, excuse-makers and games players don’t last long here. If dedication to your work and your team mates isn’t a top life priority, this isn’t the right place for you.

On the other hand: if you’re self-motivated, growth-oriented, and hard-working… and if you’re looking for the right balance of stable employment, and the freedom to shape your days and your own success… then this is where you’ll find it.

Benefits

  • Remote Work
  • Health And Dental Benefits
  • Unlimited Vacation + Major Holidays Off
  • Competitive pay, and opportunity to grow it quickly
  • Work-life balance is an essential part of our culture
  • Fun, positive, but highly driven team

items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer

Technologies

reactjssaasdesigngitalgolia

Job description

Full Stack Developer

About this job

  • Job Type: Remote full-time
  • Experience Level: Mid-Senior
  • Role: Full Stack Developer
  • Industry: Enterprise SaaS
  • Company Size: <10
  • Company Type: Private
  • Remuneration: Competitive


Technologies

  • React
  • Node
  • Firebase


Job description
Deliver towards an exciting SaaS platform with a vision to unlock the potential of data and create an intelligent world. 
We’re looking for an experienced engineer to join our passionate, lean, agile and tech-loving team on a permanent basis. 8+ years of industry experience. Our platform is innovative with amazing frontend design and UX.

You will be a polyglot with extensive experience across a wide range of technologies and projects, and will relish tackling and solving tough problems.
You’ll be comfortable designing and articulating solutions, working closely with both developers, designers, customers and partners to ensure we’re building the right thing in the right way. Understanding that delivering quality, working software, which meets the user’s needs, is paramount.

You’ll be passionate about moving Connectworxs forward and be a champion of best practices, patterns, process and technology. 

Skills & requirements
Our developers have the opportunity to work on a variety of interesting problems including new features, integrations and scalability, providing real positive change and impact for our customers. 
We lean heavily on open source and encourage our developers to contribute and be active, engaged members of the community.

We don't dictate how you work at Connectworxs, but at this stage being comfortable working remotely and being happy to be entrusted to make the right decisions is compulsory. 
As a Connectworxs software engineer, you will have the opportunity to work with cutting edge technology and be part of a hugely exciting journey. 
Our favourite tech includes:

  • React
  • React Router 4
  • MobX
  • Firebase Realtime Database, Hosting, Authentication, Functions, Storage
  • Jest
  • Algolia
  • styled-components / styled-system
  • Responsive Design
  • Git / GitLab
  • Create React App / react-app-rewired


Interested?
Please upload your application (a CV plus a motivation letter) via the application form. For more information about us you can check our website https://connectworxs.com.

Agency calls are not appreciated.

Apply now

About this job

Job type: Contract
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Desktop Developer
Industry: Software Development
Company size: 201-500 people
Company type: Private

Technologies

javajava-eespringhibernateangular

Job description

Surge Forward is looking for smart, self-motivated, experienced, senior-level consultants who enjoy the freedom of telecommuting and flexible schedules, to work as long-term, consistent (40 hrs/week) independent contractors on a variety of software development projects.

Sorry, No Visas. Must be located in the US and/ or Canada. 

We have multiple remote long term contracts for Senior Java Developers:

Full-stack Java, focus on Backend: HTML/CSS, JavaScript, DHTML, XML, Ajax, JQuery, Java, J2EE, Spring, Hibernate, SQL, SSO using SAML and OAuth is ALL REQUIRED.

Java/ Angular version 2 and above.

Only candidates located in Canada and/ or the US can be considered at this time. Sorry, No Visas.

Resume must include the tech stack under each job and if you have Angular experience, please include what version of Angular.

For immediate consideration, email resume and include your cell phone number and start date.

Apply now

About Surge

Surge is an onshore provider of custom web, cloud, mobile, digital, and desktop software development and consulting services to clients in every industry, from hot startups to Fortune 500 companies.

Founded in 2007, and listed on the Inc. 5000 list of America’s fastest growing companies for five straight years, Surge has successfully delivered hundreds of software products, apps, and solutions to its clients using a proven agile/scrum development process combined with an elite group of North American software professionals.

Simply put, Surge offers America’s best software engineers, on demand, at rates 30-50% less than the competition.

Benefits

  • Great Pay
  • Choose Your Hours
  • Work From Home
  • Work With Happy People
  • Zero Commute
  • See Your Family More
  • Travel While You Work
  • Software Provided

items.content:
About this job

Job type: Contract
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: Frontend Developer

Technologies

javascriptreactjsreduxgraphql

Job description

You are a forward thinking, creative problem solver with a passion for core JavaScript. If you’ve got the chops and want to ditch the cubicle, apply to the best lean startup development team on the planet. At Modus Create you will collaborate with a cross-functional Scrum team to deliver high quality innovative products in short sprint cycles.

This contract role may be performed from a remote location and requires a level of effort estimated at 40 hours per week. Preference will be given to candidates within the Western Hemisphere.

Responsibilities

  • Build a new UI for a successful, growing educational product
  • Write lots of quality, high performing JavaScript code using ReactJS, Redux, GraphQL
  • Collaborate daily with UX, Engineering, QA and DevOps to build and deliver an intuitive, highly visible web app
  • Collaborate, write code, write automated tests, perform code reviews and actively participate on our distributed Agile team
  • Consult to our end client regarding development best practices
  • Work 100% aligned with Western Hemisphere business hours - GMT -4 or -5

Required Skills and Experience

  • At least 2 years experience delivering high value, complex UI front-end products
  • Good understanding of modern front-end architectures
  • Strong experience with ReactJS, Redux 
  • Experience in consuming and/or developing APIs using GraphQL, is highly desirable
  • Strong Javascript basics and very good understanding of core JS (ES6/7)
  • Experience in following Agile/Scrum SDLC
  • Experience with automated unit, integration and end-to-end testing is highly desirable.
  • Be comfortable communicating in a virtual environment
  • Previous remote team experience
  • A consistent, reliable internet connection
Apply now

About Modus Create

Let’s Talk about You

You value outcomes above all else: You have a proven track record shipping great mobile and web products. By understanding the big picture, you articulate strategy and vision with strong written and verbal communication.

You Lead by Doing: You realize that the big picture is worthless without getting your hands dirty in the technical details for strategic and tactical problem solving. You understand the value of situational leadership and can adapt to the needs and strength of your team.  

You Love Work, Growth and Learning: You dream of working in a culture that values hard work, continued learning and innovation with a commitment to building amazing products for clients and their end users. You’ll stop learning when you are dead, and until then you desire to gain deeper knowledge in technology and business.

Let’s Talk About Us

Modus Create is a Product Studio offering consulting services and SaaS products for strategic planning, design and execution of web-based and mobile products. We work across multiple industries with Fortune 1000, ISVs, and startups to validate, plan and launch new products. Headquartered in Reston, VA, we are a global, bootstrapped team that has grown from 2 to 140+ people in 30+ countries in 7 years, committed to building the best product consulting firm on the planet. We offer a highly collaborative, autonomous and effective working environment. We love and believe in what we do. This is your chance to be part of building something great.

Benefits

  • Company-provided, top notch hardware, software and services
  • Competitive compensation & benefits
  • Ability to expense technical books
  • GitHub repos for your projects
  • A chance to get your personal projects sponsored
  • Travel if you like, stay at home if your don't
  • Assisted continuous self-development
  • Talk at meetups

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Frontend Developer
Industry: Assessment, Education Technology, Human Resources
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Technologies

graphqlreactjsreduxreact-apolloresponsive

Job description

Only accepting US applicants

FineTune is seeking a senior reactjs/redux front end software engineer for our Pre-AP software product.   S/he will have the opportunity to work on mission critical software that will impact 3-5 million students in 2019.  If you have been building production quality software for at least last 10 years in teams of various sizes and you are well versed in various javascript frameworks particularly Reactjs/Redux (experience with Angularjs, Emberjs a plus) and have created at least 3 production released software, and have supported and monitored them through various cycles in production, you are welcome to apply. S/he will be working with our existing platform and front end code base to refactor and use feature flags while designing the front end code to be highly modular and optimized for best user experience. We will be hitting several milestones to serve 3 million+ users in 2019.

Requirements:

  • comfortable with npm packaging/publishing,
  • webpack customization and configuration
  • experienced in developing for multiple web browsers and mobile for various platforms
  • experienced developing for responsive UI 
  • good handle of computer science
  • good handle of event driven software design pattern
  • be well versed in object oriented programming
  • be well versed in debugging REST API and graphql APIs
  • be well versed in debugging using breakpoints, source maps and Chrome developer tools
  • be well versed in test driven development
  • experience in docker based development environment a plus

S/he should also be comfortable interacting with customer and provide guidance on the technical feasibility and scope of engineering/rearchitecting needed to solve problems and deliver features.  

Front end software engineer will work very closely with the designer, business stakeholders, QA and other engineers to deliver features.  You must be well versed in test driven development (we use jest/enzyme/nightwatchjs) and find best ways to increase the speed of delivery while enhancing the quality of our software.

S/he will interface also interface with CTO to continuously drive innovation and new product development while promoting and advancing the scalability and modularization of current platform we are working on with Collegeboard.

Apply now
Ask a question

About FineTune Learning

We are working on a variety of projects from componentizing and enhancing front end reactjs to optimize user experience and reusability of components.  We are constantly collecting data on users to help recommend better resources for their learning.  We build interesting but simple dashboards that may help teachers become more data driven.  We work on behavioral experiments via randomized control trial through our software. Our backend is mostly python/sqlalchemy and supports graphql and diverse set of databases depending on the application.  Continuous integration and continuous deployment are next in our pipeline. We are facing challenges in scalability and automation which we plan to tackle in 2018 and refactor code to increase the software performance and support 5 million users.  We work with our design team to make this experience engaging for effective learning. We practice agile and scrum and strive to continuously improve.

Benefits

  • Responsible time off
  • 100% remote work/work from anywhere
  • 401k
  • Health/dental
  • Profit sharing

items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Frontend Developer
Industry: Big Data, Databases, GPU
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: VC Funded

Technologies

reactjsjavascriptreduxsqlagile

Job description

MapD is seeking an experienced software developer to add to its fast-growing Front End engineering team. This team works on delivering features and fixes at a rapid pace into an enterprise environment. We are seeking someone with a deep understanding of Javascript and prefer previous experience using React/Redux.

We’re big fans of hiring people who are not just great at what they do but also how they do it. Critical to our culture is building and maintaining a team that works well together and knows how to communicate effectively - not just within their own team, but also across peripheral teams.  

We don’t believe in divas or rock stars. We are looking for someone who embodies the best parts of open-source culture: Humility, open-mindedness, positivity, and respect for others. A developer who doesn’t try to single-handedly save the day but embraces input and collaboration as a means to find the best solution.

Your success in this role will be predicated on your ability to prioritize your work, be self-motivated and a self-starter, to speak up early and often, and to work well with others. You should be passionate about building great software, and about building a product that is slated to revolutionize the world of data analytics across multiple industries. We’re great at encouraging our people to learn different technologies, continue their professional growth, and try out new ways of doing things. We’re in it for the long-haul, and you should be too.

Our office is located in downtown San Francisco, and this position will report to the Director of Development. While our preference is to hire local employees, we will also consider exceptional candidates for remote work.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Build out features for Immerse, MapD’s award-winning data visualization platform.
  • Conscientious development: Write unit and end-to-end tests, along with thorough documentation and code commentary.
  • Competent estimation: Allocate/estimate time required to not only complete a feature, but also build in quality, unit test, regression test, and document the feature with cross-functional team.
  • Bolster your team: Provide peer review, write performant and reusable code, follow and help define code style.
  • Support peripheral teams: Product, QA, and Technical Writers are helping to make our product as robust as possible. When appropriate, developers should flesh out User Stories with any whiteboard images, mockups, short description docs, acceptance criteria, and other artifacts they have to help the entire team to understand the features under development.

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • 5 years minimum of overall professional work experience as a developer (2+ years React/Redux production experience, or a combination of either of these with several years of Javascript or equivalent framework)
  • Working knowledge of SQL
  • Previous experience working with typical Agile development workflows and working in sprints
  • Willingness to work on existing codebase without insisting on reinventing the wheel
  • Willingness and ability to prioritize working on current code and staying focused with the task(s) on hand for the purpose of meeting deadlines and project deliverables
  • Previous experience and comfort level collaborating and communicating in real-time using asynchronous tools (Slack, Github, etc.)
  • Proven previous experience solving complex challenges of architecture, user interactions, and data flow and management in a large, data-driven enterprise application with several cross-cutting concerns
  • Proven experience communicating with diplomacy and respect. Ego and attitude should be checked at the door
  • Ability to collaborate with empathy and positive intent

 BONUS POINTS:

  • Examples of coding projects on Github or other publicly available repositories
  • Experience with D3 or other visual analytics frameworks
  • Experience with geospatial visualizations (Mapbox, Mapboxgl, Leaflet, PostGIS, D3 geo)
  • Experience shipping and supporting enterprise code
  • Involvement in open source projects and/or passion projects
Apply now

About MapD

MapD is the creator of the Extreme Analytics Platform, the world’s fastest open source analytics technology. What started as a radical idea at Harvard and MIT, has grown to be a platform that is changing the way major businesses and governments gain insights from massive datasets. 

MapD has made breakthrough advancements in big data querying and visualization, by harnessing the transformative power of supercomputer-grade GPUs. Since launching our product in 2016, MapD has been recognized as a Gartner Cool Vendor, a Top Ten Coolest Big Data Startups by CRN, and is experiencing explosive growth in users and customers.

The company is backed by leading VCs and strategic investors, including NEA; Nvidia, GV (Google), In-Q-Tel, Verizon Ventures and Vanedge Capital.

Benefits

  • New Equipment (PC's, Mac, etc) for all Developers
  • Catered Lunch 3x/Week
  • Medical, Dental, Vision Paid @ 80%
  • 20 Days Paid Vacation
  • 3 Floating Holidays
  • 401K Program
  • $75 Reimbursement on Gym Membership
  • Commuter Cheque Program
  • Desirable Downtown SF Office Location (Embarcadero Center)
  • Flexible Work Hours & Remote Working Options* (*for Select Positions)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Cloud Services, Computer Software, Internet of Things
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Technologies

.netangularjssqlhtml5angular-fullstack

Job description

The Position

  • We are looking for several experienced and strong Full Stack .Net Developers to join our fast growing software development teams.  
  • We have both local (West Side of Los Angeles) as well as remote positions available

Skills we are looking for

  • Strong knowledge of the .NET framework (C#) and associated technologies
  • Experience with Web Services (WCF)
  • Minimum of 2 years of React or Angular
  • Strong Microsoft SQL Server 12+ skills
  • Proven full stack development experience
  • Strong analytical skills and good problem-solving skills
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong knowledge of SDLC and the ability to work in small team environments.

Educational Background you should have

  • Bachelor of Science degree required, ideally in computer science or mathematics
  • Master Degree a strong plus

Other Requirements

  • US citizens or Green Card holders only, no H-1b visa holders
  • PLEASE DO NOT APPLY IF YOU DO NOT MEET THIS REQUIREMENT!

Where you will work

  • We are based in Santa Monica, and for our local job openings you will be working at a client site here in Los Angeles on the West Side, close to world famous beaches, entertainment and like-minded people.
  • Relocation assistance may be considered for the right candidate.
  • NOTE: Opportunity for role to be remote where you can work from home!

What you will work on

  • Design and develop rich user-focused business applications and large enterprise systems.
  • Work on cutting edge technology with some of the world’s most exciting projects and companies.
  • Work with end-user and engineering staff to understand their needs and vision; use this knowledge to create state-of-the-art software.

Responsibilities

  • Participate in requirements analysis and develop solutions for all tiers of applications: user interface, middle-tier business components, database layer, etc.
  • Be a key contributor to innovation and build proof of concept examples that can be leveraged across current and future software release versions.
  • Work independently and/or in small teams.

What we’re looking for

  • You are restless, curious and creative.
  • You are a quick learner and are always working on and learning about the next big thing on the horizon.
  • You have a strong computer science foundation and are passionate about web development.
  • You have worked on several projects and have done your own little side projects.
  • You are a familiar name on Stack Overflow and Github and have a few open source projects on your resume.
  • Solid knowledge of web and http is critical and you know HTML5 and CSS inside out.
  • Strong React and/or Angular experience, but MUST have one or the other at a minimum
  • Familiarity with REST services and KnockoutJS are not critical but a plus.
  • Your strong coding skills in one or more language (C#, Ruby, Java, Python, Django, PHP, C++, Obj-C, etc.) have already been proven in several large projects.
  • You have worked on various ASP.NET MVC 5 applications
Apply now
Ask a question

About ixStrata, Inc.

ix-strata is a California based software engineering firm with offices in Los Angeles and New York, and additional locations in several States including California, Arizona, Nevada, Minnesota and New York.  We also have an off-shore development center in Belarus.We specialize on complex, cutting-edge technology solutions and provide highly skilled teams to a range of customers ranging from exciting internet startups to Global Fortune 500 companies on Wall Street.  Please note, we are not a recruiting firm or body shop, but a real company that provides custom software development expertise and large scale IoT solutions.

We are rapidly growing and provide not just exciting opportunities for our employees, but also ample opportunities for advancement and a very exciting and fulfilling work environment.  

Benefits

  • comprehensive health insurance
  • above standard vacation and personal days
  • pension plan
  • profit sharing plan
  • exciting work with cutting edge techologies and clients
